caption.text: Find it here: http://www.chiporro.com/ Title: Rocoto Hot Company: Chiporro Sauce Co. Description: A thick and flavorful sauce featuring the Rocoto pepper, which has an earthy flavor and great heat level. Ingredients: Rocoto peppers, Onions, Vinegar, Peppers, Tomato, Garlic, Salt, Spices, Herbs.  This sauce is Gluten Free. Smell: This sauce has such a basic ingredient list, yet has such a complicated and amazing scent to it!  The first thing you can smell are the Rocoto peppers as they give off that super distinct fruity and sweet aroma but then you get the sweetness of the tomato, onion and garlic coming into the forefront of the sauce as well.  The Rocoto pepper smell is not overbearing as it matches well with the onion, tomato and what I believe to be a bell pepper.  I do not smell the vinegar which is pleasant, and the spices and herbs are lurking in the background, possibly a basil or parsley. Pour: A very thick and creamy sauce, but pours out smoothly, little to no chunks but you can vividly see all the ingredients mixed together to create this beautiful orange sauce. Taste: This is a fantastic sauce; my mouth was watering before I even got a chance to taste it.  Straight away you get the Rocoto peppers giving off that earthy flavor with a hint of a fruitiness.  The tomato combines with this sauce well to add that extra thickness and body to the sauce.  The onion and garlic pair up well together with the tomato and Rocoto peppers.  The other pepper, spices, and herbs all come in the background and as you swallow the sauce you can taste the whole combination of the ingredients.  The vinegar is barely noticeable, and the thickness coats you‚Äôre mouth so smoothly.  I would give this sauce a 9.5/10. This would rock on any Italian foods, burgers, chicken nuggets, and for some reason fajitas. Heat: I would say that this sauce is a medium level sauce, as it has some punch that kinda lurks in the background and creeps up on you, but nothing overbearing.  I would give this sauce a 4.5/10 on heat. #hotsauce #hotsauceinmybag #hotsauceoneverything #chilihead #chiliheads #chilisauce #peppersauce #spicyfood #hotones #rocoto #pepper #hot #spicy #orange #sauce #colorado

Find it here: http://burningsweets.dk Title: The Gentle: Habanero & Lemon Lime flavor Candy Company: BurningSweets Description: Burningsweets is the perfect challenge for your friends and enemies, but also the gift nobody expects, and a great surprise for most occasions. Made in Denmark. Smell: Believe it or not, this candy has a smell to it.  You can smell a pepper like quality to it, and then a hint of the lemon lime. Taste: After the initial taste of the mildest of the candies, I cannot wait to try the rest of their products.  This is a total chilihead candy and company, and I cannot wait for BurningSweets to arrive in the states.  This stuff is incredible.  You get that super sweet Lemon-Lime flavor that you get from most hard candies, but then you get a mild habanero pepper flavor and burn that lurks in the background.  You start off with a light tingle on the tongue, and then as you swallow you get hit with a gush of the spicy goodness.  The hard hitter is when you get to the center core of this candy, then you get pounded with a strong pepper flavor and burn.  This stuff gives you a good kick at the end. This is a big hard candy and you can suck on it for a while, but oh god the flavor is incredible.  I am always skeptical of mixing sweets and spice, but this company nailed it right on the head.  Imagine having a Warhead sour candy, but replacing it with actual good flavors, and spicy peppers.  It terms of flavor, I am going to give this flavor an 8.5/10, I am very intrigued and excited to try the other flavors that are MUCH hotter. Heat: A mild habanero burn that shows and pops in this candy, it‚Äôs not hidden in the background, it collides at the same time as the lemon lime flavor. The habanero lurks for a while and you will feel the burn for a solid 5-10 minutes after finishing the candy. I would give this a 5/10 as I believe anyone could enjoy The Gentle.  #hotsauce #hotsauceinmybag #hotsauceoneverything #spicy #spicyfood #spicyfoods #spicycandy #chilihead #chiliheads #burningsweets #thegentle #habanero #hardcandy #candy #lemonlime #denmark #peppersauce #chilisauce #peppers #hotwings #hot #heat #flavor #lemon #lime #candytime #fire #denmarkfood

Find it here: www.heathotsauce.com Title: Carolina Reaper BBQ Sauce Company: Cobra Chilli Description: Cobra Chili is one of nature‚Äôs most exquisite pleasures.  With its unique blend of ingredients and expertise, one encounter will change your culinary life, dramatically.  So, go on, face the fury. Ingredients: Fresh Tomato, Sugar, Malt Vinegar, Fresh Carolina Reaper Chilli (5%), Garlic, Onion, Spices, Worcestershire Sauce, Molasses, Mustard Powder, Sea Salt, Citric Acid.  Contains barley & wheat.  All Natural sauce, No Artificial Preservatives, Flavors, or Colors. Smell: This smells fantastic, you can instantly smell the fresh tomato and then a sweetness from the sugar, reaper peppers, and molasses.  I also can pick up the garlic and onion along with some other spices.  All these flavors combine very well to give off an aromatic BBQ sauce that you would want to pour all over your food. Pour: A thick BBQ sauce, you can see the chunks of reaper, and the spices in the sauce, giving off a dark red tone. Taste: Oh, yum!  This stuff is killer in heat and flavor.  Right away you get this sweet fruity tomato flavor that is quickly pushed to the side by the sweetness of the reaper pepper, sugar and molasses.  The reaper is not super strong in flavor due to all the ingredients but is totally noticeable as you get that roasted sweetness flavor of the better.  As you swallow the sauce, you get the strong undertones of the Garlic and Onion along with the spices.  The Worcestershire sauce creates that final BBQ ingredient rounding out the sauce.  This is a superb spicy BBQ sauce and is perfect for a real Chili head.  I would give this sauce a 9.3/10 on flavor. This sauce would be fantastic on anything BBQ and grilled foods. Heat: This is a reaper sauce, made with 5% content of fresh reapers which may not seem like a lot, but even a little bit of reaper will kick you around.  A chili head will be able to enjoy this sauce completely covered in their food, but to the average Joe, it‚Äôs going to hurt.  I would give this sauce a 7.5/10 for heat.  #hotsauce #hotsauceinmybag #hotsauceoneverything #australia #cobra #carolinareaper #reaper  #chilihead #chiliheads #peppersauce  #bbq

caption.text: Find it here: www.kiwiimporter.com Title: Kaitaia Fire Chili Pepper Sauce Company: Kaitaia Fire Description: The chilies used in Kaitaia Fire are sun ripened in New Zealand‚Äôs Far North, barrel aged like a fine wine and blended to create a superior piquant flavor. Ingredients: Capsicum Frutescens (55%), Water, Cider Vinegar, Food Acid, Salt, Vegetable Gum. Made in New Zealand and All Natural. Smell: This sauce smells like Tabasco except with a more pure and natural scent.  You can smell the chilies in the forefront and since they are Capsicum Frutescens they are in the exact same ballpark as Tabasco peppers.  They use Cider vinegar which gives off a smoother smell then normal distilled vinegar. Pour: Slightly thicker consistency over tabasco, I believe the vegetable gum was used as a thickener and gave it a silky and smooth pour. Taste: This is essentially an upgraded version of tabasco, which is not a bad thing because there is a fantastic execution of this sauce.  First off, this sauce is a tad bit hotter than your standard run of the mill tabasco sauce, with a chili content of 55% there is a good number of chilies in the sauce, and you can taste the peppers as they give off that tangy and fruity flavor you can expect from a Capsicum Frutescen chili.  You can tell that these peppers were barrel aged due to the flavor because the sauce did not have that volatile oil taste.  Next, you have the Cider vinegar which completely enhanced the flavor and gives the sauce a smoother and richer edge compared to distilled vinegar.  The vegetable gum thickens the sauce out and adds a richness to the sauce as it coats your mouth.  If you enjoy Tabasco sauce or Crystal hot sauce, then you would absolutely love this sauce.  I would give it a strong 7.5/10 on flavor, not because it is bad, it‚Äôs just a simple table pepper sauce.  This would rock on eggs, chicken, beef, and literally anything you would typically use hot sauce on. Heat: A tad hotter than a typical grocery store hot sauce.  I would give it a 4/10 on heat.  #hotones #hotsauce #hotsauceinmybag #hotsauceoneverything #peppersauce #chilisauce #newzealand #kaitaia #chilihead #chiliheads #peppers #spicyfood #hot

caption.text: Find it here: www.eathot.com Title: The Brutal Bajan Hot Habanero Sauce Company: US Sauces Description: Get brutalized! Ingredients: Vinegar, Habanero pepper, mustard, onion, garlic, salt, turmeric, paprika, sorbic acid Smell: The first thing I smell is the vinegar, which is totally distilled vinegar and is extremely strong but lurking beneath it you can smell the mustard and habanero peppers which smell awesome! You get the spices of the mustard mixed with the sweet fruitiness of the habanero pepper.  I can also pick up the onion and garlic. Pour: A creamy yet loose consistency, very confusing but almost like a tomato soup consistency but with some chunkiness throughout. Taste: Extremely potent in vinegar, that is the initial taste and has a very harsh swallow.  This is a vinegar based sauce which is totally okay, but the vinegar is way too strong.  There are good things to this sauce, I do enjoy the chunks of pepper, garlic and onion in the sauce, and I feel like this sauce would be ten times better if there was less vinegar or a different type of vinegar used, because this was way too harsh. I cannot go into huge detail over the flavor because it‚Äôs simply a whole lot of vinegar and then just habanero peppers, garlic, onion and mustard.  This is a simple sauce, and would go great as a cooking ingredient if it was mixed with mayo or even yellow mustard and used as a spread on sandwiches or dips.... Yum! I also feel like this sauce would succeed on Spanish food, such as tacos or burritos.  I would give this sauce a 5.8/10 on flavor as it is an above average sauce but is in no terms a gourmet hot sauce. Heat:  The heat is there and sits for a while due to the lingering habanero but I think everyone could enjoy this sauce in moderation.  I would give it a 5.5/10 on heat.  #hotsauce #hotsauceinmybag #hotsauceoneverything #chilihead #chiliheads #habanero #mustard #barbados #chilisauce #peppersauce #spicyfood #bajan #spicy #hot #hotsaucereview #eathot #endorphinrush

Find it here: www.voodoochilesauces.com Title: Winter Angel made with Samuel Adams Winter Lager Company: Voodoo Chile Sauces & Salsas Description: This is not your typical tomato or vinegar based sauce.  Winter Angel starts with a base of roasted peppers and Samuel Adams Winter Lager, blending in spices and exotic hot peppers to bring you a spicy treat like no other.  Enjoy! Ingredients: Roasted red peppers, Samuel Adams Winter Lager, Orange Marmalade, Pepper mash including Fatalii peppers, Apple cider vinegar, Raw cane sugar, Himalayan salt, Lemon juice, Onion powder, Toasted Garlic, Coriander seed, Ginger, Szechuan peppercorn, Cumin, Cinnamon, Spices.  Contains: Wheat Smell: The initial smell that I receive is the Sam Adams Winter Lager, but then you get a strong hit of the sweet citrusy fatalii peppers and the roasted peppers.  There is a lot of citrus sweetness and spices within this sauce and the smell is absolutely fantastic. Pour: A liquidious pour, little to no chunks but is not exactly a thin sauce either as you can see all the ingredients combined together in the sauce. Taste: An interesting sauce, it starts off incredibly pepper forward, as you get the roasted red peppers and Fatalii in the forefront.  Then you get hit with the Winter lager and orange marmalade in the background giving off a nice citrusy sweetness to pair well with the Fatalii pepper.  Once you swallow the sauce you can really taste the Cinnamon, Peppercorn, and Cumin, which gives off a great aftereffect and flavor of the sauce.  This sauce would be a great table sauce and pair well with most food with a Sam Adams beer on the side.  Pizza, hamburgers, white meats, and scrambled eggs are just some ideas that popped into my head.  I would give this sauce an 8.75/10 on flavor. Heat: This sauce does have a bit of heat to it due to the Fatalii pepper mash, but nothing that will blow you out of the water.  I would consider this to be a high medium heat level sauce, and I‚Äôd give it a 6/10 on heat.  #hotsauce #spicyfood #hotsaucereview #hotsauceoneverything #hotsauceinmybag #chilihead #chiliheads #spicy #hot #peppersauce #chilisauce #samadams #samueladams #saucesomeness #sauces #fatalii

caption.text: Find it here: www.corinescuisine.com Title: Sauce No. 3 ‚Äì Spicy Hot Pepper Sauce Description: Sauce number 3 blends the heat of pickled Scotch bonnet peppers with the richness of Jamaican curry.  Try it with steak or chicken, or use a spoonful to give your mayo and mustard a little kick! Ingredients: Scotch Bonnet Peppers, Onion, Olive Oil, Apple Cider Vinegar, Garlic, Salt, Jamaican Curry.  All Natural, Nothing Artificial and Gluten- Free. Smell: An extremely beautiful aromatic smell, right out the get go you can smell the Jamaican curry and scotch bonnet peppers as they collide really well, as both ingredients give off a tropical vibe mixing together with the onion and garlic.  I can pick up light hints of the olive oil but no vinegar which is pleasant. Pour: A chunky sauce but obtains very smooth pour, as it gently floats its way out of the bottle and onto the food of your choice. Taste on Spoon: Oh my god, this is a winner.  I am so tempted to just drink the bottle.  This is a very unique hot sauce, as it completely changed the way you would think of hot sauce.  The initial taste is the combination of onion, garlic and the curry, but then POP you get that sweetness of the scotch bonnet peppers, and a little tang from the vinegar.  The olive oil really stands out and completely coats your mouth in that silky oil. Taste on food: Unfortunately, I did not have chicken, but I had a left over grilled pork chop and decided to give it a go, and it totally enhanced the flavor of the pork chop without oversaturating it.  I would give this sauce a 10/10 all day because it pushed the limits of a gourmet hot sauce, and did something incredibly different and unique.  This would go great on saut√©ed chicken, pork chops, and marinated with steak. Heat: This sauce describes itself as very hot, but I beg to differ for my heat scale I would give this a 3.3/10 on heat.  #hotsauce #hot #spicy #hotsauceinmybag #hotsauceoneverything #chilihead #chiliheads #scotchbonnet #jamaicanfood #allnatural #glutenfree #chilisauce #peppersauce #hotsauces #hotfood #spicyfood #saucesomness #sauce

Find it here: https://squareup.com/store/ecky-becky-pepper-sauce Title: Ecky Becky Pepper Sauce Company: Warren H ‚Äì Creator Description: Ecky Becky Pepper Sauce is a typical pepper sauce that you will find in Barbados, but with a twist.  We have gone back to our roots and reintroduced Horseradish into our ingredients, something that was used traditionally but was ceased.  The Scotch Bonnets, Horseradish and the rest of the ingredients really enhances Ecky Becky‚Äôs kick and we feel it compliments any meal. Ingredients: Scotch Bonnet Peppers, Onions, Garlic, Tumeric, Horseradish, Vinegar, Salt, Hot Mustard.  There is no added sugars or preservatives. Smell: I love the smell of this sauce!  The first thing you smell is the tropical scotch bonnet peppers that give off a very floral and sweet smell to it, but then your nostrils get kicked by the onion, garlic, horseradish, and other spices.  The hot mustard also comes into effect but kind of lurks in the background. Pour: A thick and chunky sauce, you can see all the ingredients used and the horseradish and pepper pops. Taste:  This sauce is very pepper forward, as you instantly taste the Scotch Bonnet peppers as they give off an incredible floral/tropical flavor that combines really well with the horseradish giving you a nice kick, and then the spices come into play.  The onions, garlic, turmeric, and mustard all come into play in the middle ground and help compliment the sauce.  You only get a slight hint of vinegar and the salt helps out but could maybe be turned down just a slight notch.  I was worried about the horseradish being overpowering but it was not! It combined really well with the scotch bonnet peppers.  This is a great floral and savory hot sauce that would be great on red meats, such as burgers or steak and on certain seafood dishes. I would give this new startup company a 8.8/10 on the sauce. Heat: This is a strong pepper forward scotch bonnet sauce that has a powerful kick to it.  I'd give it a 7.5/10 on heat as it won't melt your face off but is hot! #hotsauce #chilihead #chilisauce #scotchbonnet #spicyfood #hotsauceinmybag #hotsauceoneverything #horseradish #barbados #spicy #hot #sauce

caption.text: Find it here: www.kiwiimporter.com Title: Waha Wera Kiwifruit & Habanero Sauce Company: Kaitaia Fire Description: Waha Wera means burning mouth in Maori and this fruity hot sauce lives up to its name.  A gold medalist at the Fiery Foods Challenge in Albuquerque. Made with habanero peppers organically grown in the far north of New Zealand and milled with iconic New Zealand flavors: kiwifruit and Manuka honey. Ingredients: Kiwifruit (55%), Sugar, Water, Habanero Chilies (14%), Manuka Honey, Salt, Food Acids, Spices. Free of coloring, preservatives or any other artificial additive. Smell: A simple yet unique aroma, as I never pictured kiwi being implemented into a hot sauce.  Right out of the get-go you can smell the kiwifruit, as it gives a super fruity and sweet aroma, combined with the Manuka honey which is a thick and creamy honey but then lurking right around the corner is the habanero chilies which collide well with the kiwifruit due to the habanero having such a sweet and fruity aroma. Pour: A very silky and smooth pour, it has an almost syrup like consistency.  No chunks but you can see the kiwifruit seeds within the sauce. Taste: Wow, what an incredibly unique tasting sauce.  The first thing you taste is the kiwifruit, and then the habanero chilies pop into the picture creating an extremely fruity and sweet sauce. The honey pops in and compliments it very well, as the honey is a big character in the sauce and helps to balance everything out.  This sauce has a very unique taste for being such a simple ingredient list.  The sauce is very thick and syrupy most likely from the honey and kiwifruit, as it does coat you‚Äôre mouth slightly.  I think this sauce would be a great marinade for chicken, or applied to tacos to create a sweet and savory dish.  I would give this sauce a solid 8.5/10, if you ever wanted to experience kiwi in a hot sauce, this would be perfect for you. Heat: A slightly above mild habanero kick that gives you a nice gentle mouth burn that lingers for a while. I would give this a 4/10 on heat. #hotsauce #kiwi #manukahoney #newzealand #habanero #spicy #hot #chilihead #chiliheads #hotsauceinmybag #peppersauce #hotsauceoneverything

Find it here: www.pexpeppers.com Title: Atomic Purple Company: PexPeppers Description: This delicious sauce has been created by berries grown in the shadow of Chernobyl.  Featuring fresh splashes of blueberry, cantaloupe, strawberries, and a supreme nuclear blast of Ghost Peppers; this mix can stand in as fuel for any nuclear reactor (can also be used as a condiment). Ingredients: Ghost, Blueberries, Strawberries, Cantaloupe, White Vinegar, Balsamic Vinegar, Wildflower Honey. Label: I am no longer going to be reviewing labels, as I would rather focus more character space on the sauce itself for now. Smell: The initial whiff is the strong fruity scent of the ghost, but then it becomes mixed into what would be like a fruit bowl, with the blueberries, strawberries and cantaloupe all combining together to give just an incredible aroma.  You can also pick up light notes of the very aromatic wildflower honey. Pour: Smooth pour, with a little thickness to it, almost like a steak sauce form of consistency. Taste:  The initial taste is an explosion of fruit. It's as if you were drinking a smoothie,the berries and cantaloupe pop as they coat your tongue and give you a delicious and sweet sauce that combines with the honey to act as a prank, as you swallow the sauce you instantly get hit with the heat of the ghost and then you get this slow building time bomb of ghost heat.  The ghost also combines really well with the fruit because of the fruity nature of the pepper.  Barely tasted the vinegar but is slightly present. This sauce would go great on pork dishes, ice cream, waffles, and white meats.  I‚Äôd give this sauce an 8.8/10 on flavor, Pex always hit‚Äôs it right on the money! Heat: Oh geez, this sauce is a total chilihead sauce. This is a strong ghost pepper sauce and will give you a strong throat and tongue burn that will get hotter and hotter as time progresses.  Use sparingly, unless you are crazy like me and eat a whole spoonful of this stuff, 9.8/10 on heat.  #hotsauce #hot #spicy #chilihead #peppersauce #ghostpepper #atomic #chilisauce #hotsauceinmybag #hotsauceoneverything #chiliheads #pexpeppers #wings #hotwings #honey #fruits #hotsauceaddict

caption.text: Find it here: www.heathotsauce.com Title: Habanero White Cheddar Popcorn Seasoning  Company: Heat Hot Sauce Description: This award winning white cheddar seasoning has a serious habanero kick to it.  Designed for popcorn, but try it in Mac and Cheese too!  Ingredients: Organic White Cheddar Powder, Organic Habanero Powder Label: Simple yet professional, I really enjoy the color choices, and the text font for HEAT is great, 8.8/10 on label design.  Smell: Strong powder cheese smell with a good hint of the habanero powder, it does not smell like a whole lot, but you can expect that.  Taste: I tried this stuff with some simple grocery store buttered popcorn, and this stuff completely enhances the flavor of your popcorn, because you get this incredible mix of buttery, cheesy, and sweet habanero all mixed together to give you an incredible snack.  When you take that soft and crunchy chew from your favorite popcorn, the cheese is a nice quality and you can really taste the difference if you were to compare it to Smartfoods white cheddar popcorn.  This stuff from heat kicks it out of the ball park!  The habanero powder adds a touch of sweetness before giving you the burn.  I plan to try this on Mac n Cheese one day because they recommend doing it on the bottle, and I think it would be fantastic.  I would give this seasoning a 9.8/10 all day, I think this would be a 10/10 if there was just a touch of maybe a garlic/onion powder thrown in, not a lot, but just a pinch.  Heat: This is a moderate heat that I believe almost anyone could enjoy.  The habanero powder kicks in fast, giving you a smooth tongue burn and roof of the mouth burn, that sticks around for a while and lingers depending on how much you eat.  I feel like a chili head would love to cover their popcorn with this stuff, and use a heavy amount to give them a nice burn, but at the same time anyone could enjoy this stuff to a degree.  You can also adjust how much of the seasoning you actually apply, 5.5/10 on heat.  #hotsauce #popcorn #popcorntime #hotsauceinmybag #hotsauce #hotsauceoneverything #chilihead #chiliheads #peppersauce #chilisauce #heat #spicy #hot #heathotsauceshop #habanero #whitechedder

Find it here: www.bootlikker.com  Title: Bootlikker Hot Sauce  Company: Bootlikker  Ingredients: Cayenne Peppers, Vinegar, Tequila, Jalapenos Peppers, Garlic, Onions, Water, Salt, Xanthan Gum, Sodium Benzoate, Spices, Citric Acid, and Soybean Oil  Label: The label fits the name of the sauce, I wish there was some kind of description somewhere on the label, describing the type of flavor.  I really enjoy the flask type bottle, as I feel like it fits with the brand and style of sauce.  Label is going to get a 6.5/10 because it is just missing something.  Smell: A very strong vinegar based sauce, right out of the water you smell just vinegar, and mostly vinegar, but I do smell a bit of the tequila, and then in the undertone, you can smell the peppers and some spices. Pour: Smooth consistency, this is a runny sauce, there are no chunks, same kind of consistency as Franks Red Hot, maybe a bit thicker than tabasco.  Taste:  My first impression of this sauce is that it‚Äôs basically a step higher from being a grocery store hot sauce.  You first taste the vinegar, and tequila, but then you get a combo kick of both the cayenne peppers and jalapenos peppers, giving you that perfect everyday hot sauce kick.  The sauce is tangy, with a hint of sweetness. The garlic and onion stand in the background and are not super noticeable, but are subtle. I think what makes this sauce unique is the use of tequila because the tequila is present, but not overbearing, as it combines really well with the vinegar to enhance the flavor.  This sauce is basically going to be used as you're standard everyday table hot sauce, as I believe it would go well with anything you use tabasco on.  I think tacos would be fantastic with this sauce because of the tequila.  I would give this sauce a 7/10 as it is truly a great vinegar based hot sauce, Its just rather simple. Heat: This sauce with the combination of cayenne and jalape√±o peppers, gives you a nice tingle, 3.8/10 on heat. #hotsauce #tequila #spicy #peppersauce #chilisauce #hot #hotsauceinmybag #hotsauceoneverything #bootlikker #chilihead #chiliheads #cayenne #jalapeno

Find it here: www.eathot.com Title: Endorphin Rush Beyond Hot Sauce  Company: US Sauce Inc.  Description: Here‚Äôs the rush you‚Äôve wanted to experience!  Release the sensation that only the very special taste of Endorphin Rush can!  Heightens any food: first an explosion of flavor, then a wave of heat! The rush that goes beyond hot! Caution: This sauce is extremely hot.  Avoid contact with eyes and sensitive areas.  Ingredients: tomato paste, water, pepper extract, vinegar, sugar, molasses, soy sauce, sulfites  Label: Nice label, nothing to complain about much, the text for sauce on the bottom is a bit hard to read, but I like all the trippy tie-dye colors of the bottle, 7.5/10 on label design.  Smell:  I smell 2 things, metallic pepper extract, and tomato, I can pick up some light notes of vinegar.  I don‚Äôt smell the molasses much, but I assume that it is used as a thickener. Taste:  The first thing I taste is the tomato, and sugar, as it gives you this sweet and tart tomato based hot sauce flavor, but then right after you taste that metallic pepper extract flavor which really detracts from a lot of the flavor, and then you get hit with the vinegar and soy sauce as well, combining together. Pepper extract has the one job and purpose of being hot, not flavorful and that is exactly what this sauce is meant to do, but that being said, this is one of the more tasteful pepper extract sauces I have had, as I think a few drops added into any tomato dish, such as pasta would be great.  4/10 on flavor, because its goal is to be hot, not flavorful.  Heat: The heat comes from pepper extract, so real peppers are not used in this sauce, so you don‚Äôt get that actual pepper flavor you would expect in a hot sauce.  Pepper extract is extremely hot and eating a spoonful of this stuff will give you an endorphin rush, and a kick in the ass even for a chili head because extract is just rough stuff, to a normal person, a single drop would have them going for the milk. 10/10 on heat. #hotsauce #spicy #hot #hotsaucelover #hotsauceheaven #chilihead #endorphins #endorphinrush #chiliheads #pepperextract #peppersauce #chilisauce #hotsauceoneverything #hotsauceinmybag #endorphinrushhotsauce

caption.text: Find it here: www.heathotsauce.com  Title: Habanero Chili Sauce  Company: Cobra Chili  Description: The Cobra is one of nature‚Äôs most exquisite predators.  Graceful and majestic, an encounter with one will change your life, dramatically.  Similarly, Cobra Chili is one of nature‚Äôs most exquisite pleasures.  With its unique blend of ingredients and expertise, one encounter will change your culinary life, dramatically.  So go on, face the fury.  Ingredients: Fresh Tomato, Fresh Red Habanero Chili (30%), Onion, Sugar, Vinegar, Garlic, Citric Acid (330), Sea Salt, Spices.  This product is made in Australia, and sold at Heat Hot Sauce in the States, and has No Artificial Preservatives, Flavors, or Colors, No Water Added and is Naturally Gluten Free.  Label: For the whole line of sauces, I absolutely love the label and bottle, it just comes off very professional, and I love the pepper scale on the back.  I wish the colors were just a tad brighter but overall 9.8/10 on label.  Smell: The first thing that I pick up is a really sweet and fresh tomato aroma that quickly gets pushed to the side by the strong blast of the red habanero pepper as you get that naturally smoky and fruity habanero smell.  I can pick up in the back some light notes of onion and garlic.  Pour: Smooth consistency with just a touch of chunkiness.  Taste:  Incredible, right away I can say that this is an all-purpose sauce.  Straight forward you get a combination of tomato and red habanero peppers that give you a fresh, savory, sweet and a touch of smoky combination that collide as it mixes with the onion, garlic and spices.  There is very little vinegar flavor which is nice, because it really brings out the flavor of the pepper and tomato.  This sauce would be fantastic on all BBQ‚Äôd meats, on your breakfast eggs, wings, pizza, steak, and pasta.  I‚Äôd give this sauce a 9.5/10  Heat:  This sauce does have a kick since 30% of the bottle is Red Habanero chili, so you do get a very fast building and long term lingering mouth burn.  6.8/10 on heat. #hotsauce #spicy #hot #hotsauceoneverything #hotsauceinmybag #chilihead #cobrachili #cobra #habanero #chilihead #chilisauce #peppersauce #tomato #garlic #onion

caption.text: Find it here: www.trinipeppersauce.co  Title: Trini Pepper Sauce  Company: Trini Pepper Sauce Co.  Description: Trini Pepper Sauce is a family recipe from Trinidad and Tobago, inspired by 5 generations of sauce makers.  Made from fresh scotch bonnet and scorpion peppers, this sauce is a unique tasting, incredibly flavorful addition that is guaranteed to add excitement to your meal.  Ingredients: Scotch Bonnet Chili Pepper, Papaya, Vinegar, Garlic, Water, Prepared Mustard, Lemon Juice, Salt, Sugar, Cilantro, Trinidad Moruga Scorpion Chili Pepper  Label: Sample bottle didn't come with label, but looks cool!Smell:  Very interesting smell, as you can really smell the tropical fruity whiff of the scotch bonnet and scorpion pepper, along with the Papaya, but at the same time you get a strong mustardish vibe as both the fruity smell and the mustard collide creating a truly unique smelling sauce.  Pour:  Smooth pour, it is a chunkier sauce, as you can see a lot of chunks and strands of pepper, seeds, and other ingredients mixed around in the sauce.  I adore the color!  Taste:  Right out he get go you get a touch of sweetness around the thick mustard body of the sauce.  The scotch bonnet peppers stay with you during the flavor journey as you get that tropical fruity and earthy flavor sensation, along with a touch of the papaya.  The mustard sticks around for a while and mixes in really well with the garlic and cilantro.  You get a savory sauce with just a little touch of sweetness from the peppers and sugar.  The scotch bonnet peppers and scorpion peppers collide really well, and as you swallow the sauce, you get blasted into flavor utopia as you get hit with the heat of the almighty scorpion pepper.  This is a great table sauce, and can be dumped on any savory dishes, especially chicken and pork.  9.5/10 on flavor.  Heat:  This sauce is classified as hot, the scotch bonnet pepper alone is a decently hot pepper, plus adding the scorpion!  POW! But it's not the hottest scorpion sauce around and is tolerable and enjoyable. 7.8/10 on heat. #hotsauce #spicy #trinidadandtobago #hot #chilihead #chiliheads #scorpionpepper #scotchbonnet #peppersauce #hotsauceoneverything

caption.text: Find it here: www.highriversauces.com. Title: Hellacious Hot Sauce  Company: High River Sauces  Description: The Hellacious Hot Sauce is robust and bold with expressive flavor. Devilishly addictive on your burgers, steak, chicken, pork and pizza.  Ingredients: White Vinegar, Habanero Mash, Agave, Smoked Jalapeno, Roasted Red Pepper, Minced Garlic, lime Juice  Label: I have decided to start going in less detail about my opinion on labels, because it really is all about the sauce itself, so I do want to say that this is a beautiful label, and all of the high river sauce labels are beautiful and excellent.  The label is truly a work of art in itself, there is an incredible amount of detail. 10/10 on label.  Smell: the smell is very simple, but robust, as you get this awesome bit of sweetness from the habanero and agave, but then you get this earthy smoky aroma which is probably from smoked jalapeno and roasted red pepper.  I can pull a bit of the garlic in the undertone, the vinegar is present but so far not overbearing.  The peppers really stand out.  Pour: Very liquidious pour, a step higher then water.  You can see strands of pepper, and some seeds, and the garlic.  Taste: Wowzers, this stuff is fantastic.  Right off the bat you get kicked with the habanero mash as it gives you a total flavor bomb from the sweetness of the habanero pepper, agave, and lime juice but the the overall taste of this hot sauce is very robust, and smoky.  The roasted pepper, and smoked jalapeno and garlic mix together with the habanero mash to make a delicious sauce.  The vinegar is present, but it doesn‚Äôt bother me because of the rest of the ingredients kicking its ass.  I plan to marinate my burgers with this sauce before grilling them, and they are going to be bomb!  This is a very tasteful sauce for all grilled meats.  10/10 on flavor  Heat: The mixture combination of all 3 peppers, gives you a good all-around mouth burn. This sauce would be a 4/10 on heat as I think everyone could enjoy this sauce.  #hotsauce #peppersauce #chilihead #chiliheads #spicy #hot #habanero #wings #hotsauceinmybag #hotsauceoneverything #pepper #highriversauces #nychotsauceexpo

caption.text:
Find it here: www.asskickin.com Title: Habanero Honey Peanuts  Company: Ass Kickin‚Äô  Ingredients: Peanuts roasted in Peanut Oil, Sugar, Honey, Salt, Modified Potato Starch, Habanero Pepper and Keltrol  Label: I do enjoy the label design for most of the ass kickin products just for the fact that the donkey has become such an icon for the company and it really stands out with its bright colors.  The honey pot logo on the can also pops to me because something about sweet honey, peanuts, and habanero peppers sounds like a match in heaven.  8.5/10 on label.  Smell: Interesting, I was expecting to smell some of the habanero powder but I don‚Äôt smell anything hot at all, I just smell normal honey roasted peanuts.  Taste: Really crunchy and high quality peanut, you really get smooth and crunchy peanut bite, and you taste the sweet honey and sugar that is coating the peanut, but then as you chew the peanuts, and swallow it, you get a mellow habanero back of the throat burn that just kinda sits there and lingers.  The ass kickin line of sauces and snacks has never impressed me, and this one still has not impressed me.  It claims to be ‚ÄúKick Yo‚Äô Ass Hot!‚Äù but is not, its mediocre.  The flavor of the peanut is good but nothing that will blow you out of the water.  4.5/10 on taste, as it‚Äôs just a tad below being average, I‚Äôd give it a 5, but it was just a disappointment because I wanted more heat, out of something called ‚ÄúAss Kickin‚Äù and the words "habanero". Heat: There is a very mild back of the throat burn that lingers for a few seconds, and im talking very mild.  I ate numerous handfuls of this stuff to make sure that I was not missing something, but no.  Anyone in the world could eat this stuff and be okay, maybe someone who is super sensitive to heat would find this hot, but they would be able to at least eat a handful comfortably.  1.3/10 on heat

caption.text:
Find it here:www.magohotsauce.com
Title: Roasted Green Thai Hot Sauce Company: Mago Description: Our green Thai pepper blend is a spicy and tangy delight.  Our Mago Green recipe is even hotter than its red brother.  We‚Äôve mixed habaneros and jalapenos with the Thai peppers for a sauce unlike any other.  We throw in a hint of ginger to complete this unique recipe.  The tangy spicy magic! Ingredients: Water, Thai Chilies, Jalapeno peppers, cider vinegar, habanero peppers, garlic, sea salt, brown sugar, dried onions, ginger, xanthan gum.  This product is gluten free, Vegan friendly, and has no preservatives or allergens. Label: As with their other sauce, I love the label. Same idea. 10/10 on label design. Smell: The first thing I smell is a really earthy pepper smell, which comes from the jalapeno peppers and Thai chilies, but then I get this robust spice combination from the garlic, onions and ginger.  I can briefly smell the cider vinegar, and I do get a little smell hint of sweetness from the habanero pepper and brown sugar. Pour: A smooth pour, no chunks at all.  You can see some strands of pepper along with some pieces of garlic, onion, and ginger. Taste: Bam, you taste the Thai chilies, because they have such a nice earthy robust flavor.  Seriously this stuff rocks!  The Thai chilies are roasted which make the flavor pop out.  You also get this very mellow sweetness from the habanero pepper and brown sugar that creates a nice touch as you swallow the sauce.  The vinegar is present, because it is a vinegar based sauce but since they use cider vinegar, it‚Äôs nothing overbearing.  The spices and ginger help balance the sauce.  This would be a great table sauce to dump on most food, especially burritos, and thai food. I‚Äôd give this sauce a 9/10 on flavor as well, and fully justifies itself to be partnered with the Mago red.  Heat: this sauce is hotter then their original red sauce, as it does kick it up a notch.  The combination of the peppers give a nice tongue burn that lingers.  Most people can enjoy this sauce, but it is a tad hot.  4.5/10 on heat.  #hotsauce #chilihead #mago #thai #spicy #hot #hotsauceinmybag #hotsauceoneverything #peppersauce #spicyfood

I have no knowledge of the peppers used or the total ingredient list used for the sauces, so I will just be giving my overall opinion on the taste and heat without giving a number based rating, because I do not want to say anything misleading.  Thanks and Enjoy!  Title: Plank Town Foggy Scotsman Porter Hot Sauce Company: FYM hot sauce.  Taste: the only thing I know about this sauce is that it is made with raspberries, chocolate, and barrel aged porter.  Right off the bat you can taste that sweet fruity flavor of the raspberries but then you get this light and airy chocolate taste that combines really well with the porter.  You get a zip of the porter as you swallow the sauce.  I prefer the IPA sauce over this one, but is still a great sauce, and highly enjoyable.  I wish the raspberries could be toned down and the chocolate could be brightened because chocolate and porter is just a match made in heaven, and would make this sauce a very unique hot sauce.  Heat: this sauce is a step up from the IPA sauce, as you do get a really nice tongue burn.  I ate 2 tablespoons of this stuff, and my tongue got a nice little warm burn that felt great.  Still could be enjoyed by everyone, but the heat is a tad hotter and the heat does linger which is nice.  #hotsauce #porter #planktown #planktownbrewing #fymhotsauce #hotsauceoneverything #hotsauceinmybag #hot #spicy #chilihead #chiliheads #pepper #peppersauce

Thanks and enjoy!  Title: Unobtainium IPA Hot Sauce Company: FYM Hot Sauce Taste: Very flavorful, you get this smooth and savory sweet heat, this sauce is very fresh.  You can absolutely taste the double IPA beer in the sauce but it does not overwhelm the flavor.  It has a really great hop bite from the beer.  You can really taste the hoppiness.  This sauce would compliment any food, and would be an excellent marinade, or drenched over any food, especially if you have a nice cold IPA I'm sure both the beer and sauce would compliment each other perfectly.  The sauce starts with a sweet fruity citrus flavor that rolls off the tongue but then as you swallow the sauce you get that warm hoppy IPA flavor that rolls down your throat.  Fantastic Sauce! Find it here: www.hellahothotsauce.com Title: Garlic Death Grip Company: Hella Hot Hot Sauce Description: Our garlic death grip sauce is a collaboration with the all mighty techno destructo, co creator of the band fear and also wrestles in freak show wrestling.  Techno and myself created a powerful garlic based hot sauce to bring on the garlic death grip!  Ingredients: Tomato, Habanero, Jalape√±o, White Onion, Apple, Distilled Water, Garlic, Leek, Green Onion, Citrus Juice, Brown Sugar, Distilled Vinegar, Sea Salt, Chipotle Powder, Herbs and Spices.  Label: Very eye catching label, you notice this sauce very fast by seeing the bottle.  I love the colorful red and yellow text along with the chains.  The whole design makes you feel like someone is gripping onto you.  8/10 on label.  Smell: As soon as I took the cap off, POW! Garlic stands in the major forefront, so right away you know that this is truly the garlic death grip.  I can also get strong hints of the onion, habanero, and tomato.  Pour: Totally a chunkier sauce, you can still pour it out rather smoothly but it has some big chunks of garlic, onion, habanero, jalape√±o and other ingredients.  Taste: This is a interesting and unique sauce to say the least, it has an extremely strong garlic and onion flavor which is expected in this sauce, which shadows over the flavor of the peppers to a degree, but the heat is totally there!This sauce has a very earthy flavor, due to the number of veggies.  You get some sweetness but it's very light.  The vinegar is not overbearing.  If you like garlic and onion you will enjoy this sauce a lot.  My biggest issue is finding stuff that I would use with this sauce, because it's not the type of sauce you can just dump on food.  Instead this sauce would be better used as a cooking ingredient such as a marinade for meats or added to homemade soup, 7.8/10 on flavor. Heat: this sauce has a good kick of habanero that lights up your tongue straight away, this is a very tongue dominate burn sauce, 6/10 on heat as its an above average burn. #hotsauce #garlic #onion #technodestructo #gwar #chilihead #chiliheads #peppersauce #hotsauceoneverything #hot #spicy #hotsauceinmybag #habanero

Find it here: www.defconsauces.com Title: Defense Condition 1 All-Purpose Wing Sauce Extreme Heat Company: Defcon Sauces Description: WARNING: This is an extreme sauce, made with special extracts which can be very dangerous if misused! Please use with caution! Sample a small amount before use.  Keep out of reach from children, preferably next to the refrigerated insecticides.  Ingredients: Aged cayenne peppers, distilled vinegar, water, salt, garlic powder, cream, white wine vinegar, natural flavors, and pepper extract.  All natural, No MSG, and gluten free.  Label: Defcon sauces are known for their interesting medicine bottle type shape and the famous Defcon label.  I do enjoy the label because it displays as if it shouldn't be for human consumption but I do feel like it's clustered with text.  6/10 on label.  Smell: smells like a typical cayenne wing sauce, I do get the vinegar, garlic powder, and something else but I can't put my finger on it. Pour: thick sauce, slowly dribbles out of the bottle like silk.  Taste: This is a beautiful and hot wing sauce, you straight up get that nice thick wing sauce coating around your mouth as you taste the aged cayenne pepper, vinegar, and garlic powder.  I believe the cream that is used is a great thickener compared to Xantham gum and adds more flavor and texture to the sauce.  The heat is mainly from the pepper extract which I believe is a habanero pepper extract that is all natural.  He uses just a tad of the extract so that it does not overwhelm or destroy the flavor.  It's a perfect balance of heat and flavor.  I tried it on some boneless wings and they were bomb! I'm going to go through this like ketchup.  No wonder this sauce has won many awards including the screaming Mimi! This would go great on anything fried, pizza, pasta, sandwiches, or anything else you would put wing sauce on! 9.8/10 on flavor. Heat: this is hot but not as hot as the warning label leads you to believe. Nice all around burn. 5.5/10 on my heat scale as I think most people could handle this sauce, but it is hotter than average.  #hotsauce #hotwings #buffalowings #buffalosauce #defcon #chilihead #peppers #hotsauceoneverything #buffalo

caption.text: Find it here: www.bravadospice.com Title: Crimson Hot Sauce Company: Bravado Spice Co.  Description: A bold blend of red jalape√±o and Arbol chilis, this sauce is bursting with undeniable flavor. From tacos to noodles, Crimson Hot Sauce is the new standard. It's a legend in the making.  Ingredients: Arbol Chilies, Red Jalape√±os, White Wine Vinegar, Garlic, Sea Salt, Sugar Label: Just like my other reviews for this company, the label is color coded, clean, and professional.  I give this label an 8/10, as I really like the typography and design.  No changes in label.  Smell: straight up pepper smell, you can really get that natural and earthy smell from the small Arbol chilies, along with the fresh red jalape√±os, but then you get a hint of the garlic and white wine vinegar.  Color: A dark red color with some seeds and garlic seen throughout the sauce, including strands of pepper.  Pour: Very liquidious pour, the same type of consistency as your typical grocery store Tabasco sauce.  Taste: Alright, this is a superb and delicious vinegar based table sauce.  The Arbol chilies and red jalape√±os are the forefront of flavor in this sauce, as you get that earthy, natural, kinda nutty flavor from the Arbol chili, but then you get the combination from the sweet red jalape√±o which combines really well together.  Then you get hit with a nice garlic note, and then ending with the light zip of the white wine vinegar.  I think the white wine vinegar is a great choice compared to other vinegar options.  I really enjoy how the vinegar and sweetness clash together.  This sauce would be great on wings, especially if you add some melted butter to the sauce, along with Mexican dishes, pizza, and fried chicken.  Strong 9.5/10 on flavor.  This is seriously a great vinegar based red sauce that can be used on EVERYTHING.  Heat: the combo of the Arbol chili and jalape√±o give you a mild-medium tongue and lip burn.  I think anyone could enjoy this sauce as a typical table sauce instead of cholula or Tabasco.  3/10 on heat.  #hotsauce #spicy #hot #peppersauce #chiliheads #hotsauceoneverything #hotsauceinmybag #jalapeno #arbol #chilihead #bravado #bravadospice #hotsauces

caption.text: Find it here: www.mazi401.com Title: Piri Piri Sauce Company: Mazi Description: Fierce, Fiery & Fun, This small batched, hand stirred, authentic Portuguese hot sauce packs it's flavor with tomato, Piri Piri pepper, oil, vinegar, garlic, lemon juice &a Whiskey.  Shake well! To tame the fire, simply use as a marinade, however if the heat is on & there's no turning back try it straight up... On the side of course.  Ingredients: found in the description.  Label: simple but eye catching label, as it uses 100% recycled packaging, you have to give credit where credit is due.  The cork top and wax helps the packaging stand out as a gourmet small batch sauce.  I would give this a 7.5/10 on label and packaging.  Smell: the first thing I smell is that super fresh tomato sauce smell, but then you can get the little sting of the distinct Piri Piri pepper and the zing of the garlic and lemon juice.  The oil and vinegar sits in the middle and I don't smell the whiskey.  Pour: no chunks, smooth pour, but not super runny, it's like a lighter ketchup.  Taste: the first thing you taste is the tomato and it has a nice sweetness but then the Piri Piri pepper hits you and gives you that whole mouth flavor of the pepper.  The oil and vinegar is heavily present in this sauce, so if you are not into oil or vinegar based sauces you may want to stay clear of this, but that being said, this is a true and authentic Portuguese hot sauce and by far one of the better Piri Piri sauces I have tasted.  The garlic and whisky come in as an after tone.  This would go great marinated on ribs, or Portuguese style steak and chicken.  I would give this sauce a 7.5/10 on flavor.  Heat: low to moderate heat, as it sets off a good medium level sauce.  The Piri Piri pepper gives you an earthy zingy throat burn that is very relaxing and warm.  This sauce can be enjoyed by most especially if used as a marinade.  I'd give this a 3.5/10 on heat.  #hotsauce #hotsauceoneverything #hotsauceinmybag #piripiri #mazi #asburypark #chilihead #chiliheads #peppersauce #hot #spicy

caption.text: Find it here: www.magohotsauce.com  Title: Roasted Habanero Company: Mago Hot Sauce Description: this is a habanero sauce for everyone.  Mago Red is our roasted habanero blend.  This full-bodied hot sauce is unlike any other. This recipe mixes tropical sweetness with a subtle roasted smokeyness, all paired with the perfect amount of garlic, onion, vinegar and salt.  Ingredients: chili peppers (Fresno, habanero), water, cider vinegar, malt vinegar, sea salt, garlic, dried onion, xantham gum.  This product is gluten free, no preservatives, no allergens, and is vegan friendly.  Label: this label is beautiful, the typography and design of the label is a huge selling point for this sauce.  The label really pops out the color of the sauce, with the black and slight redness to the label design.  I give this label a 10/10 as it is truly a professional and eye catching bottle of sauce and really stood out on my shelf.  Smell: the smell is simple but refreshing as you get a hint of sweetness from the habanero and Fresno pepper but then get hints of garlic, and onion along with the cider vinegar, I don't pick up much of the malt.  Pour: A very smooth and silky consistency, you can see some strands of pepper and seeds within the sauce along with some of the onion and garlic.  Taste: wow, bam.  This is a great table sauce guys.  You get this light sweetness from the peppers along with a hint of smokeyness from the Fresno.  It's super refreshing and smooth.  As the sauce hits your tongue you get the garlic and onion.  The vinegar is present but not overbearing as this is a vinegar based sauce with an emphasis on the peppers.  The silkiness of the sauce coats your whole mouth in a nice way.  This sauce would be great on tacos, chicken, red meat, and used as a dip. 9/10 on flavor.  Awesome! Heat: even though this is a habanero sauce, the heat is mild which makes this sauce usable by everyone.  Seriously, anyone could enjoy this sauce.  3/10 on heat as its about a notch hotter then a typical grocery store sauce.  #hotsauce #hotsauceinmybag #hotsauceoneverything #habanero #chilihead #chiliheads #spicy #hot #spicyfood #elephant #fresno #artisan

caption.text: Find it here: www.hellahothotsauce.com Title: Brain Jerk Company: Hella Hot Hot Sauce Description: Inspired by the band Ghoul and the Portuguese Piri Piri sauce, this is truly an amazing hot sauce like non other that Hella Hot Hot Sauce has on the self.  Ingredients: Orange Juice, Distilled Water, Red Bell Pepper, African Birds Eye pepper, Habanero, Shallot, Distilled Vinegar, Coconut Oil, Chipotle Powder, Lemon twist, Sea Salt, Garlic, Herbs and Spices.  Label: really eye catching label art, as the bright yellow and red colors collide really well to make the bottle pop out, including the Ghoul band inspired figure on the bottle.  The bottle itself is really eye catching and professional.  9/10 on label design.  Smell: the first thing I smell is the distinct birds eye chili pepper, along with the sweetness of the orange juice and habanero.  The sauce has a very unique aroma as you can't really pick out one or two individual ingredients because there are so many mixed into this sauce.  Pour: very straightforward and easy pour, almost looks to be creamy but also chunky as you can see all the ingredients put into this sauce, as you see some herbs, garlic, and pepper seeds.  Taste: right off the bat you get this sweet and smokey taste in your mouth as you get a citrus tang from the orange juice and habanero, but then directly after you get this smokey hit from the birds eye chili.  This sauce hits you fast with the heat.  It's a very natural and smooth tasting sauce, as you don't really taste the vinegar.  This sauce has a great consistency and would be great to be used as a table sauce.  Pizza, chicken, steak, burgers, anything you would typically pour hot sauce on, this would rock, as you get a smokey sauce with a bit of sweet citrus and garlic and herbs. 8.7/10 on flavor.  Heat: the mixture of the Birds eye and habanero give this sauce a unique and hard hitting burn as both peppers give you an instant tongue and throat burn that lingers for a while.  This sauce is hot and will truly give you a Brain Jerk 8/10 on heat.  Tags: #hotsauce #spicy #hotsauceoneverything #hotsauceinmybag #hot #chilihead #chiliheads #peppersauce #ghoul #birdseyechilli #habanero #spicyfood

caption.text: Get it here www.bravadospice.com Title: Jalape√±o & Green Apple Hot Sauce.  Company: Bravado Spice Co.  Description: Granny Smith apples blended with only the freshest peppers and garlic.  This isn't your typical "Green" sauce; it's a game changer.  Ingredients: Green Apple, Poblano peppers, Jalape√±o, White wine vinegar, Garlic, Sea salt.  This product is 100% vegan friendly.  Label: just like my other reviews for this company, the label is color coded, clean, and professional.  I give this label an 8/10, as I really like the typography and design.  No changes in label.  Smell: the first thing I smell is peppers, as you really get that earthy poblano and jalape√±o aroma, but then you get the sweet undertone of the green apple and hint of garlic.  The aroma is very simple and straightforward like the ingredients.  Pour: the sauce is much thicker than their ghost pepper and habanero sauce.  I actually had to hit the spoon a bit to get the sauce to come out, which was a good thing.  It is rather nice to see a little change in the sauce consistency from this company.  You can see the mashed up peppers and apple.  Taste: At first taste you get the sweet and sour zing from the apples, the apples are a huge part of the flavor profile of this sauce.  The green apple has such a distinct sweet and sour flavor that it detracts a bit of the earthiness of the peppers, as the apples are in the forefront of flavor and the peppers lurk in the background.  You then get a bit of the garlic and salt along with the zip of white wine vinegar as you finish the sauce.  Personally, I think apple cider vinegar may work better for this sauce.  I will say I'm not a huge fan of green sauces, but this sauce is one of the better green sauces I have ever had, as it's naturally sweet and earthy and tastes refreshing.  This would go great on fish tacos, eggs, breakfast food, and a refreshing summertime dish. A 6/10 personally but if someone enjoyed green sauce a lot, they would bump up the score.  Heat: Very mild, light tongue burn and throat burn that dissipates rather quickly. 2/10 on heat.  #hotsauce #hotsauceoneverything #hotsauceinmybag #spicy #hot #chilihead #chiliheads #jalapeno

I got to experience Chicken or the Egg recently in Long Beach Island NJ, where they are famous for their wings and were featured on Man Vs Food for their Ludacris Wing Challenge.  I got 2 plates of 6 wings and I couldn't even finish them all.  These wings were jumbo size and breaded and super tender and delicious.  The first sauce I picked, featured in the far back was their santos sauce, which was a combination of BBQ, Garlic, and Spicy goodness.  The wings in the front is their obscene sauce which is one step below Ludacris, and it was very hot, it got me sweating a tad after the 3rd wing but it also tasted very delicious.  Usually in my opinion I don't like the taste of Buffalo Wild Wings "Wild" sauce, but these obscene wings were hotter and way more tasty then those wings.  If you are ever in Long Beach Island you have to give this place a try, because it will light up your taste buds.  Just be warned they are always busy.  We almost waited 2 hours for a table! #hotsauce #hotwings #buffalowings #hotsauceoneverything #hotsauceinmybag #chilihead #chiliheads #spicy #hot #chickenortheegg #chicken #egg #wings #spicyfood #hotfood #fries #sauce

Find the sauce at www.luckydoghotsauce.com Title: Year of the Dog Thai Chilie Pineapple Hot Sauce Company: Lucky Dog Description: Impossibly delicious Thai Chili pineapple hot sauce, with toasted onion, roasted garlic, toasted sesame, honey, ginger and lime. Aleppo Peppers round out the flavor profile to create a unique and savory hot sauce.  Ingredients: Pineapple, Rice Vinegar, Onion, Roasted Garlic, Honey, Dried Red Chilies, Toasted onion, Sea Salt, Agave, Lime Juice, Ginger, Dried Garlic, mustard flour, toasted sesame seeds.  Label: the artwork on this bottle is actually gorgeous, I love the signature dog and horseshoe logo as it surrounds this beautiful mural almost painting like display, as it has a pineapple and a bee on the label to help describe the flavors.  9.8/10 on the label, I'd just like to see the color pop out a tad more.  Smell: the first thing I smell is the garlic and onion, as it pops into my nostrils, but then I can smell the pineapple, ginger and the distinct Thai chili smell.  Taste: PINEAPPLE, but then onion, garlic and honey surround your tastebuds giving you this sweet and savory sauce that you will instantly love, seriously holy hell.  The ginger pops out right at the end along with a hint of sesame.  I tried this on a microwaveable frozen General tso chicken and it turned the food into a flavor utopia.  The ginger and Sesame really stood out when applied to the food.  The rice vinegar was a great choice as it doesn't mask the flavor.  10/10 on flavor as I really feel like this hits the mark as being classified as a gourmet hot sauce.  I could see this on steak, burgers, Chinese food, pizza, and poured on a sandwich.  Very versatile sauce.  Heat: once you swallow the sauce, the heat strikes, as the Thai chili gives you a pleasant roof of the mouth and tongue burn that sticks around for a while but doesn't harm you.  3.5/10 on heat as I think the general public would enjoy this sauce.  #hotsauce #hotsauceoneverything #hotsauceinmybag #spicy #spicyfood #chilihead #chiliheads #thai #luckydog #peppersauce #peppers

caption.text: Get it here: www.angrygoatpepperco.com.  Title: Purple Hippo Hot Sauce Company: Angry Goat Pepper Co.  Description: Our "Purple Hippo" has one of the most unique flavors there is, Prickly Pear fruit has a watermelon/bubblegum flavor that pairs very well with spicy peppers.  We combined the prickly pear with habanero and scorpion peppers and rounded it off with strawberries to create a one of a kind sauce.  Ingredients: Prickly pear cactus juice, agave nectar, habanero peppers, jalape√±o peppers, red bell peppers, Apple cider vinegar, strawberries, pure cane sugar, lemon juice, lime juice, sea salt, scorpion peppers.  Label: this is one of my favorite labels so far, the pure artistic choice of each sauce containing a hand drawn animal character brings the sauce to life as well as color coding each label depending on the sauce.  10/10 on label design.  Smell: the smell is truly unique as you can instantly pick up the strange sweetness of the prickly pear and the agave nectar, but then get a blast of the peppers.  You can smell the habanero and jalape√±o, and a bit of the red bell and scorpion.  You also get a whiff of the tanginess of the juices.  Taste: really unbelievable flavor, initially you get struck with this super sweet watermelon/bubblegumish flavor along with a honey like taste from the agave, and the fruitiness of the strawberries, but then BAM! You get hit with the heat and flavor of the peppers very shorty after, as you get the sweetness of the habanero and scorpion peppers along with earthy notes from the jalape√±o and red bell, then to top it off you get the crispness of the juices and vinegar.  This sauce has a thick and chunky consistency.  This would go great on chicken, pork, ice cream, chicken and waffles really comes to mind.  Really multipurpose sauce.  9.8/10 on flavor, as this is truly a beautiful gourmet and unique sauce.  Heat: this sauce is going to kick you around, as habanero peppers and scorpion peppers strike the back of the throat and tongue instantly.  This is a chilihead sauce.  8.8/10 on heat.  Tags: #hotsauce #hotsauceoneverything #scorpionpepper #chilihead #hotsauceinmybag #spicy #pricklypear #spicyfood

caption.text: Find it here: www.thelube.com.  Title: Atomic Wing Sauce Company: Quaker Steak & Lube Restaurant.  Ingredients: Aged Cayenne Pepper, Water, Distilled Vinegar, Habanero pepper, spices, Salt, Vegetable oil, modified food starch, Garlic, Xantham Gum, Sodium Benzoate.  Label & Packaging: in my opinion for a super hot gimmick wing sauce, the packaging is really cool, the idea that it comes in a medicine bottle and comes in a little medicine dropper bottle is really neat.  They even give you a while warning waiver to sign and if you send it to them, they will send you a free bumper sticker which is nice.  7.5/10 on packaging and label design.  Smell: it smells like a typical wing sauce, you can pick up the vinegar and cayenne pepper, but then you can start to smell the habaneros very lightly, but there is a bit of a chemical smell.  Something unnatural.  Pour: it has a thick consistency almost the same consistency as A1 steak sauce.  Color: the color is really scary, as it has a brownish black color.  Taste: Instant taste of vinegar and cayenne peppers, it has just a normal wing sauce flavor but then you get this instant kick of habanero peppers which offer a bit of sweetness to the sauce.  There is not really anything interesting to say about this sauce as it is just very typical.  You can taste a few spices and a small hint of garlic.  This would go great on wings (obviously), pizza and if you were really crazy, use this as a dip on raw shrimp.  I would give this a 5/10 on flavor because it's honestly just an average flavor.  Heat: You would think that this sauce would be an extract based sauce because of the bottle and packaging but there is no extract used in this sauce.  It does give a good natural habanero burn and it will give you a back of the throat and mouth burn almost instantly.  If you drenched some wings with this sauce, you will be in for a sweat induced burn.  7.5/10 on heat, because it really gives you a good habanero burn.  A full tablespoon of this stuff and you will be sweating. caption.text: Find it here: www.bravadospice.com.  Title: Pineapple & Habanero Company: Bravado Spice Co.  Description: A blend of fresh pineapple and fiery habanero; this sweet and spicy sauce is packed with only real chilies and fruit.  Sometimes nature hands you an ace in the hole.  Ingredients: Pineapple, Habanero, Yellow Bell Pepper, White Wine Vinegar, Garlic, Sea Salt. 100% Vegan Friendly.  Label: just like their other line of sauces, the label is the same except for the color.  I have no complaints about the label as it is very clean and professional.  I really do like how they color code their sauces.  The typography was also a excellent choice.  8/10 on marketing.  Smell: interesting smell, because right off the bat I smell the yellow bell peppers and habanero before smelling the pineapple, but you get this really sweet smelling undertone from the pineapple, as well as a hint of the garlic.  Pour: Just like their ghost pepper sauce, this sauce is very thin and runny, which is not a bad thing because thin and chunky sauces each have their own separate place in the hot sauce realm.  Color: A gold yellow and orange color, which really sets off a tropical vibe.Taste: BAM! Sweetness!  You get this crazy natural sweetness from the combination of habanero peppers and pineapple, along with fruity notes of the yellow bell pepper, then you get an after tone of the garlic in the back of the throat.  I did not get any sting from the vinegar which is nice for a sweet sauce.  Honestly, a beautiful sauce, the initial taste is like drinking straight pineapple juice.  This is a basic sauce, with a brilliant execution.  If you are a chilihead you would probably enjoy drinking right from the bottle.  This sauce would go great on chicken, fish tacos, seafood, or a marinade, also Hawaiian pizza comes to mind.  9.3/10 for flavor.  Heat: the sweetness of the sauce really lowers the heat level of the habanero pepper, they also removed the seeds.  This sauce can be enjoyed by most people.  A light back of the throat and tongue burn.  4.3/10 on heat.  Tags: #hotsauce #hotsauceoneverything #hot #spicy #pineapple #habanero #chilihead #chiliheads #peppers #peppersauce #hotsauceinmybag

caption.text: Get it here: www.bravadospice.com.  Title: Ghost Pepper & Blueberry Company: Bravado Spice Co.  Description: Let's step up your hot sauce game: Fresh berries, cracked black pepper and ghost peppers.  This is what hot sauce is meant to taste like.  Ingredients: Blueberry, Raspberry, White wine vinegar, Ghost pepper, Ground black pepper, Sea Salt.  This product is 100% Vegan.  Label: Super clean and professional looking label, there is no gimmicks or attempt to scare you with the ghost pepper.  They are simply stating the type of sauce and company logo.  I love the typography and the color choices for the label, at the same time the label is a bit bare and not eye catching.  8/10 on marketing.  Smell: the first thing I smell is the blueberry and raspberry combo, but then you get a sting in your nose from the ghost pepper, and a slight hint of black pepper.  Pour: Extremely liquidious pour,  no chunks at all, water like consistency, relatable to Tabasco.  Color: Dark purple color.  Taste: You get an instant sweetness from the blueberry with a little sour bite from the raspberry, but overall you get the smokey ghost pepper flavor.  This sauce is very sweet, but I feel like the amount of vinegar detracts from the flavor even using white wine vinegar, it's a bit overwhelming.  You get the little aftertaste of the black pepper towards the end.  My hardest issue is finding food to pair well with this sauce, considering it's super sweet and fruity flavor and water like consistency, this would work well as a marinade, or on ice cream, or even some blueberry ghost wings.  I would give give this sauce a 7/10 on flavor.  Heat: this sauce does give you a good ghost pepper burn.  This sauce is hot.  You get an instant tongue and roof of the mouth burn and then as you swallow the sauce you get a back of the throat burn that continues to creep up on you, hence the name ghost pepper.  The heat builds for a while and will give you a good kick.  8/10 for heat! caption.text: Find it here:www.hellahothotsauce.com.  Title: Carrot Apple Company: Hella Hot Hot Sauce.  Description: After searching the world over for the best hot sauce, we decided to obey our own irrepressible urge to create a hot sauce like none other. Ingredients: Carrot, Apple, Habanero, Serrano, Tomato, lemon juice, orange juice, brown sugar, distilled vinegar, distilled water, curry powder, sea salt, herbs and spices.  Label: I really dig this label, not only is it artistic, but also very eye catching.  Just looking at the bottle makes you want to reach out and grab it to check it out.  The label features a drawing of the creator Kyle Colson.  I would give the label an 8.5/10 for marketing effort.  Smell: this sauce has an incredible aromatic smell.  You instantly smell the sweetness from the apples and habaneros but then get an earthy aroma from the carrots and Serrano peppers.Pour: this sauce has a very different consistency, as it appears to be a thin sauce but then turns out to be a chunky sauce as you get a big glob of apples and carrots and peppers all pouring out of the bottle. Taste: this is an incredibly unique gourmet hot sauce.  The flavor profile alone makes it very unique.  You get hit with the sweetness from the apple and habaneros but then get hit with the earthy fresh carrots and Serranos.  The spices come into play as you taste what appears to be garlic and some other spices, but you get this continuing tang from the juices.  It all ends with a light note of herbs. You taste very little vinegar which is nice.  This sauce would be gorgeous on lighter meats such as chicken, turkey or fish.  I think this would be good on fish tacos, or a grilled chicken sandwich.  Strong 9/10 on flavor, if you are looking for a unique sweet earthy and chunky sauce.  This is the one!  Heat: you get a beautiful habanero and Serrano burn that gives a moderate all around mouth burn.  This could be enjoyed by most people unless super sensitive to heat.  5.3/10 on heat.  Tags: #hotsauce #hotsauceoneverything #spicy #carrots #apples #hot thanks again for sending this sauce out to me Kyle!

Find it here at www.deanosjalapenos.com.  Title:Jalape√±o Chips Cheddar Company: Deano's Jalape√±os.  Description: Try a slice of spice, made in Vermont.  Hand crafted in small batches.  Ingredients: jalape√±os, canola oil, cornstarch, whey, buttermilk solids, cheeses, whey protein concentrate, salt, sodium phosphate, citric acid, yellow 5 and 6, lactic acid, enzyme.  Contains milk products and is made in a facility where wheat is present.  Label: simple, yet eye catching label.  The big green jalape√±o and flames draws in my eyes to the product.  Not the mention the shiny gold bag.  Nothing too spectacular but simple and straight to the point.  5/10 on marketing as it fits in to be average, as if you would find it at a grocery store.  Smell: the smell from the bag gives you a very light dried jalape√±o smell, but it is very minuscule.  I do not smell any type of cheddar cheese.  Taste: this is a very simple product but fits a good market as it is a healthy food product.  It is simply jalape√±o slices cut up and fried in canola oil, with a slight amount of cheddar flavor.  This is a good healthy and spicy snack if you enjoy the flavor of jalape√±os it's going to be perfect.  It have a great crispy and crunchy bite.  There is a lack of cheddar flavor as its there but very slightly.  I wish there was a bit more of a cheddar flavor.  Very low amount of salt which is a plus.  I would give this product a 6.5/10 on flavor as its a great healthy snack, but I wish there was a hint more of cheddar into the mix to conside with the earthyness of the jalape√±o.  That being said, it's purpose is to be a healthy snack.  Heat: the heat from this is low, as you are eating jalape√±o slices, and I believe the seeds are removed which lowers the heat even more.  After eating a handful, you do get a bit of a throat burn.  I would give this a 3/10 on heat as I believe this product could be enjoyed by a mass audience.  You just get a little tingle that burns slightly more the more you eat.  Tags: #hotsauce #jalapenos #spicy #spicyfood #spicysnacks #spicysnack #hot #chilihead #peppers #peppersauce #hotsauceoneverything #chips #cheddar

caption.text: Find it here: www.elijahsxtreme.com Title: Elijah's Xtreme Ghost Pepper Sauce.  Company: Elijah's Xtreme Gourmet Sauces.  Description: The bottle has a very long yet interesting description and story on the bottle, but to summarize it all, this is a father and son hot sauce company that is made in cherryville, NC and was inspired by Elijah and his fathers passion to create a better tasting, hotter, thicker, hot sauce.  This sauce has won numerous awards for its perfect balance of heat and taste.  Ingredients- Naga Jolokia peppers, habanero peppers, water, tomatoes, salt, vinegar, garlic, roasted garlic, onion, lime juice, xantham gum, passion fruit juice.  This product is all fresh, vegan, and gluten free certified.  Label- I really like this label, I find that the label is very professional and I absolutely love the typography on the bottle. The story on the bottle also gives the bottle a lot of character and a great selling point.  7.8/10 on marketing.  Smell: right off the bat you smell the smokey ghost peppers but then you get the sweet heat smell of habaneros, and I can also pick up the tomatoes and garlic.  Pour: This sauce is very smooth with no chunks in the sauce at all.  It has a ketchup like consistency.  The pour is very silky and smooth.  Taste: you start with a very sweet taste from the sweetness of the tomato and habanero peppers, sugar, and lime juice but then you can taste the freshness of the garlic and onion.  The sauce has an all around smoky note from the ghost peppers but nothing overpowering.  I do not taste the vinegar at all which is a good thing.  This is a beautiful sauce and very versatile.  It would be a great table sauce.  I feel like it can go great on everything. 9.5/10 on flavor.  Heat: this sauce is truly a ghost pepper sauce and is hot!  You can really bring out the flavor profile of the ghost pepper and habanero in this sauce. The smokiness and sweetness of the ghost pepper compliments the robust flavor of the habanero.  You get an instant kick of heat from the habanero but then a creeping powerful ghost pepper burn. 8/10 on heat.  Tags: #hotsauce #ghostpepper #hotsauceoneverything #chilihead #chili #spicy #spicyfood #hot

caption.text: Get it here: www.rt11.com.  Title-Mama Zuma's Revenge Habanero Potato Chips.  Company-Route 11. Description- get too close to mama Zina and you will get burned.  This woman is determined to scotch everyone in her path.  Mama Zuma's weapons are the hottest jalape√±o and habanero peppers this side of the Rio Grande.  Since she lost the love of her life in a bizarre and tragic potato peeler accident, mama Zuma's has been hell bent on burning every mouth she kisses with her special brand of passion.  Ingredients- select potatoes, expeller pressed high Oleic sunflower oil, dehydrated cane juice, salt, paprika, habanero powder, garlic powder, spices, natural smoke flavor, paprika extract.  All natural,  no trans fat, wheat and gluten free.  Label-  I really enjoy the design on the bag of chips.  It really sets the mood that these chips will be good and give a good heat and the little story on the back of the bag really gives this bag of chips some excitement and selling point.  9/10 on label.  Smell-smelling the bag you can't really pick up a whole lot smell wise. Color-light red color with a kettle cooked chip consistency.  Taste- the chips have a perfect kettle cooked chip crunch to them and they feel very natural.  Some spicy chips taste like chemicals but you don't get it from this.  These potatoes are fresh and cooked to perfection.  You can get a good taste of the habanero powder and paprika.  The habanero powder gives the chips a sweetness to it before you get the burn.  You can taste a BBQ type flavor from it before getting hit with the habanero.  Really enjoyable. 8.5/10 on flavor.  Heat-compared to most spicy chips found at grocery stores, this one is hotter then hot Cheetos by a mile.  After eating about 10 chips in a row you get a nice slow building back of the mouth burn.  You really do get a moderate habanero burn for a chip.  5/10 on heat as it would be a perfect heat level for the average person.  May be too hot for some.  Tags-#hotsauce #peppersauce #habanero #potatochips #spicyfood #spicysnacks #spicy #hot #hotsauceoneverything #hotsauceinmybag #peppers #chilihead #chiliheads

caption.text: Get it here- www.pexpeppers.com.  Company- PexPeppers  Description- Get REVENGE on your food, this is the tweaked brainchild of a madman down in North Carolina who had a taste for fire.  Revenge BBQ will go great on anything you can throw at it.  Chicken, Burgers, and More!  Let your tongue decide it's revenge.  The heat rating on the bottle is 5/10.  Made in PA.  Ingredients- Red Habanero Peppers, Tomato Pur√©e, vinegar, Brown sugar, red onion, garlic, salt, mustard.  Label- for a small batch and small company hot sauce, the label is very simple but professional.  Each of his bottles features the killerbee pepper logo which fits his line of sauces very well since PexPeppers uses there own home grown wildflower honey in many sauces!  5/10 on label.  Smell- you instantly pick up the sweet smell of red habaneros and tomato, and then you can smell the undertone of sugar, onion and garlic.  Pour- very silky and almost perfect consistency.  There is little to no chunks in this sauce, and a few seeds here and there.  Color- medium/bright red with specks of garlic and onion seen throughout.  Taste- we got a winner here guys!  This is a beautiful sauce.  Right off the bat you get a perfect hit of sweetness from the tomato, brown sugar and habanero peppers, with a garlic and onion aftertaste.  The red habaneros are sweet and fit right into a BBQ themed hot sauce.  I enjoyed this sauce with some Portuguese BBQ spare ribs by pouring it all over.  I highly recommend giving this sauce a shot.  There is vinegar but you barely taste it.  9/10 on flavor.  Heat- this sauce gives a strong habanero burn as it gives you a slow building back of the throat and tongue burn.  I feel the 5/10 heat rating is perfect for chili heads but for the general public id give it a 6.5/10 as this sauce does pack a punch!
