caption.text: Title- Jalape√±o Hot Sauce Company-Brick Farm Market- located in Hopewell NJ.  Label- very simple label, it simply has the farmers market logo, and states that the sauce was made in house, and the type of hot sauce it is such as this one states it is a Jalape√±o hot sauce.  Nothing extremely eye catching but is exactly what you would expect to see at a farmers market.  No gimmicks just straight to the point.  3.5/10 on marketing.  Smell- all I can really smell is the Jalape√±o peppers and Vinegar, and maybe a slight undertone of onion and garlic.  Pour- chunky and thick consistency but yet it pours out of the bottle very smooth and silky.  Color- light green with specks of the garlic, onion, and pepper mash.  I do not see any seeds in this sauce.  Taste- very simple flavor profile, if you enjoy the taste of a jalape√±o pepper you will enjoy this hot sauce as long as you can withstand the vinegar.  If you are not a fan of vinegar based sauces, then you will most likely not enjoy this as there is a strong sour punch of vinegar.  This sauce is kind of a jalape√±o pur√©e as there is a lot of pepper mash in this sauce.  You can slightly taste the onion and garlic but it is not very prevalent.  There is also a bit of a salty undertone which I did not enjoy.  This is a very basic vinegar based jalape√±o sauce with nothing extremely special.  I would give it a 5/10 as it is a completely average sauce.  Use this sauce as you would use with any table hot sauce such as Frank's or Tabasco.  Heat- being more of a pepper mash there is a decent jalape√±o bite to it, but with the removal of the seeds it helps balance the heat.  I feel as though this sauce gives you that jalape√±o flavor of what would be similarly a green bell pepper but with an extra kick.  Very earthy and fresh sauce.  It gives you an all around mouth burn that subsides moderately fast.  3.5/10 on heat.  Tags- #hotsauce #chiliheads #spicyfood #spicy #buffalowings #jalapeno #peppers #hot #farmersmarket #chilihead #hotsauceoneverything #hotsauceinmybag #hotsaucelover #hotsauceaddict #hotsauceporn

caption.text: Quick Grocery Store Review!  Title- Devils Spit BBQ Sauce.  Company- Famous Dave's.  Description- Straight from Hell's Kitchen.  A devilishly good hot sauce, so damn tasty it's almost sinful!  Only the hottest peppers stolen from the Devils own backyard were used.  Caution may have aphrodisiac side effects!  Ingredients- too many to list, could not find any actual peppers on ingredient list.  Weird.  Label- for a spicy BBQ sauce, I enjoy the label.  I have eaten at the restaurant a few times and thought it was OK for a BBQ chain restaurant.  The label fits the name of the product and it has an adorable famous daves pig character spitting out fire and wearing a devil costume.  The bottle says for adults only and XXX hot but we will see about that!  6.5/10 on label design.  Smell- smells like a typical sweet BBQ sauce, I personally do not smell any spices or anything spicy.  Pour- Normal thick BBQ sauce consistency.  Color- Darkish brown with little black specks and being able to see some spices mixed into the sauce.  Taste- the taste is nothing surprising, but I will say it is above average when it comes to grocery store BBQ sauce.  It is in no way a gourmet bbq sauce.  You get the normal sweet tangy BBQ sauce flavor but then get a mild tongue burn and back of the throat burn.  This would be good for BBQ chicken, pulled pork and anything else you would add BBQ sauce too.  I would give this a 5.5/10 on flavor because it is slightly above average when compared to most grocery store BBQ sauce.  Heat- this an an OK burn when putting it into perspective that it is sold in a big supermarket.  The burn is a back of the throat and tongue burn.  If you use it sparingly, there would be almost no heat but if you drenched your food you would get an OK burn.  I'd compare it to the heat level of tapatio or cholula sauce.  3.5/10 on heat. caption.text: Title- Sinclair's Fatalii Hot Sauce. Company- Sweet Heat Gourmet.  Find them at www.sweetheatgourmet.com. Description- "Meet Your Farmers" proudly made from central PA ingredients from: Meadow View Farm and Clan Stewart Farm.  All our products are made with as much local central PA produce as possible.  Your purchase directly supports their farms.  Ingredients-Apple cider vinegar, crushed tomatoes, Fatalii peppers, carrots, fresh lime juice, lime zest, sugar, spices.  This is gluten free, dairy free and vegan friendly.  Label- very basic but professional looking label.  They are simply saying "hey we make homegrown fresh hot sauce from local farms, try us out and support" it really brings a farmers market vibe to the sauce.  I do enjoy the typography choice on the label 6.5/10 on marketing.  Smell- the aroma from the sauce lets you get a good whiff of the citrusy vibe of the Fatalii peppers, then you can smell the apple cider vinegar and lime juice with a slight undertone of the fresh crushed tomatoes.  Pour- the sauce has a good consistency. It is very smooth.  Color- I would say it has a marmalade orange color, and you can see the strands of tomatoes, lime zest, and peppers in the sauce.  Taste- the sauce has a simple yet flavorful profile.  You instantly taste a slightly citrusy flavor from the Fatalii peppers, then you get hit in the throat from the tang of the apple cider vinegar which is personally one of my favorite vinegar choices for hot sauce.  Then as you finish and swallow the sauce you get a tomatoey and lime hit.  The sauce is very sweet, you can taste the crushed tomatoes, lime, and peppers on your tongue from the thickness of the sauce.  I feel like this would go great on chicken dishes, burritos, burgers, pizza, and maybe mixed into orange chicken.  I would give this sauce a 8.3/10 on flavor.  Heat- There is quite a bit of heat from this sauce, and they do not turn down the heat of the Fatalii.  It gives you a great tongue burn, which corresponds to the tang and sourness of the peppers.  6.8/10 for heat.  #hotsauce #fatalii #spicy #spicyfood #spice #hotsauceoneverything #hotsauceporn #wings #chilihead #hot #hotpeppers

Get it here: www.sonoranspice.com.  Title- Ghost Pepper Zombie Dust.  Company-Sonoran spice company Description- Remember pixy stix growing up?  This is way better and not for little kids.  It's ghost pepper fire dust.  A sugary cherry flavored powder infused with ghost pepper.  It's super sweet and VERY HOT! Ingredients- Dextrose, Caffeine, Ghost pepper powder, Malic Acid, Hydrogenated Vegetable oil, Artificial flavors and colors.  Caffeine-90mg per test tube.  Design- compact test tube bottle that fits nicely in your pocket for on the go candy snacking.  8.5/10 on design.  Smell- you smell a artificial candy cherry smell that you would get from a pixy stix but then you can smell he ghost pepper powder as it erupts up your nostrils.  Texture- powdery chalky look with little chunks.  It has a sand like substance to it.  Color-Bright red/lightish dark orange with little white specks in it.  Taste-  Very sweet off the bat, the powder melts right off of your tongue and you get an explosion of cherry flavor, it has the exact same cherry flavor as a cherry skittle or lollipop.  Very sweet and delicious and then the heat instantly hits your tongue and back of your throat in a slow ghost pepper burn.  Taste-9/10,  really awesome on the go caffeinated candy that you could stick in your pocket and enjoy.  Heat- this is a chili head candy.  You need to be able to be at a ghost pepper tolerance to really enjoy.  This is not for the everyday consumer.  If you want a candy that's gonna give you a slow ghost pepper burn on your tongue and throat.  This is for you, but you do not taste the ghost pepper in the candy.  Only the cherry awesomeness.  7.5/10 for heat. caption.text: Title- Oh My Garlic Sauce Company- Torchbearer Sauces. Description from bottle- Accidentally Healthy Intentionally Delicious!  Ingredients- Garlic, Canola Oil, Lime Juice, Distilled White Vinegar, Dijon Mustard, Water, Chili Powder, Black Pepper, and Salt.  This product is Gluten-Free. Label- super colorful cartoon vampire label.  I really enjoy how this company uses a lot of unique artistic characters for each bottle of sauce.  The bottle itself stands out.  8.5/10 on marketing.  Smell- The smell is dominated by the garlic and Dijon mustard, which you can expect from this sauce.  You also get a hint of the pepper powder/black pepper.  Pour- Extremely smooth but runny pour.  No chunks to this sauce.  Color- Darkish white color with hints of black spots on it, most likely the black pepper.  Taste- instantly get his with a blast of garlic that stays throughout the entire flavor journey, the garlic is very flavorful and natural, the second thing you pick up on is the Dijon mustard and black pepper.  I personally didn't taste the pepper powder which is a good thing for this sauce.  As you finish the flavor journey you get hit with the bite of the lime juice.  This sauce would be great for some garlic wings, or pasta dishes, or a spread on sandwiches, or a ranch porkchop! I would give it a 7/10 for flavor.  Heat- Even though this sauce comes from a hot sauce/BBQ sauce company, this sauce is not trying to be a hot sauce.  There is little to no heat.  If you never had hot sauce in your life, you might be able to get a slight tingle.  I'd give it a 0/10 for heat.  I would be curious to see a garlic sauce like this, with actual heat to it.  Torchbearer Sauces has some very flavorful wing and hot sauces.  Check them out! caption.text: Owem G. Willikers Chocolaty Chile Elixirs by: www.omgwillikers.com.  Description: A perfect blend of pure cocoa butter, salted caramel and just a hint of dried chilies and dark rum makes the perfect mix for your next cocktail party!  How about a drizzle over some warm brownies or grilled peaches & vanilla ice cream?  Ingredients- Pure cane sugar, water, organic cocoa butter, vanilla bean, bhut jolokia powder, rum Esscense, salt, natural flavors.  Made with non-GMO ingredients.  Label- I really enjoy the shape of the bottle because it has a rustic old times bottle that you would almost see in an ice cream parlor.  The artwork on the bottle also has a very old fashioned look to it which really fits with what they are going for in design.  It also comes with a cork too on the bottle. 7.5/10 for label and bottle design.  Smell- you can get a sweet white chocolate smell and then get struck by the salted caramel, there is very little to no smell of the dried ghost, but a hint of rum.  Pour- very thick and creamy dessert sauce that instantly makes you want to pour it over ice cream.  Color- A darkish white/ carmakers color with little red spends of dried ghost chilies.  Taste- very creamy texture, instantly get hit with the white chocolate and then as it rests on your palette you get covered with the beautiful salted caramel flavor as it rolls off your tongue.  Afterwards you get the rum after tone, and a very light back of the throat burn from the ghost pepper.  This sauce would be beautiful on cheesecake, ice cream, brownies, and warm sugar cookies.  8.5/10 on flavor.  Heat- the dessert sauce is very mild and it should be, because this is trying to reach a broad audience.  It's a great example of how a super hot chili such as a ghost pepper can be used mildly for a bit of heat and flavor.  The ghost brings in a dash of smokiness and a slight but enjoyable back of the throat burn.  3/10 for heat. caption.text: Tears of the Sun Hot Sauce by: High River Sauces.  Description-A deliciously dangerous blend of habanero peppers and tropical fruit.  Your taste buds are greeted by the sweetness, then rising like the sun on a hot summer day the heat settles in to make this unique sauce.  Chicken, pork, fish, and even a bagel with cream cheese...If your food is crying for help... It's crying for some Tears of the Sun!  Ingredients- Apple cider vinegar, pineapple, peaches, papaya, mango, orange habanero pepper, water, brown sugar, lime juices, ginger, salt, garlic, crushed red pepper.  Label- Beautiful bright orange sun logo with a tropical Hawaiian face that fits the name of the sauce very well and is very eye catching in color.  8/10 on label design.  Smell- the smell from the bottle gives off a very tropical vibe, you can defiantly smell the pineapple and peaches but then you get struck with the distinct smell of orange habaneros.  Pour- very easy pour, and does have some chunks and thickness to it, basically the perfect consistency for a tropical sauce if that makes sense. üòÇ. Color- has a darkish orange/yellow color, you can see some seeds, and some strands and chunks of pineapple and peaches, as well as I believe mango and papaya.  It really fits the color of what you would believe the tears of the sun would look like!  Taste- instantly taste of pineapple and peaches first, then you taste the chunks of pineapple, and then get hit with the aftertaste of mango and papaya, as you swallow the sauce you taste the pepper and heat.  The Orange habaneros have a very sweet heat, which combines well with the pineapple and peaches.  This sauce would go very well on burgers, pizza (especially Hawaiian pizza), and marinated on grilled chicken or pork.  There is a ton of uses for this yummy sauce.  I would give it a 8/10 on flavor.  Heat- average around the tongue burn.  5/10 for heat.  Tags- #spicy #hotsauce #hotsauceoneverything #sauce #burn #chilihead #hotsaucelover #hotsauceporn
